text: Hi everyone :slightly_smiling_face: I'm a front-end dev / digital marketer at a large tech startup. Taking over a lot of our HubSpot development and operations but totally new to the platform
Hello my name is Benjo from Philippines CMS and HubSpot developer, im new here hoping to help others and to learn more. Have a great day everyone!
HI Guys, Need a help !
I am working on HubSpot forms. I have two forms in a multi step way
first form  has email address and next one has questions
When I checked form submissions for the contact, I saw first ones submissions but couldnt find second form submission
is it because I dint include email address in second form? Is it a mandatory field to be included in each form inorder to associate data to right contact
btw, I get the form submission emails for both forms

data for contacts is mapped to email addresses, theoretically it should tie them together using a cookie though. You could add the email address field, make sure autopopulate is enabled, and visually hide the field. should work then
thanks Jon, will try that way :slightly_smiling_face:

Hi Jon, Both my forms are on same page. So inorder to actually autopopulate using query string you need to provide user with the query paremeters. But as both forms are on same page, I dont have a redirect link to second form page. Please correct me if my understanding is wrong

I wasn’t actually thinking of using the query string method I was thinking the cookie method but even then that’s not likely to work since you say they’re on the same page, you’re going to have to use JS to do it
Stephanie, are you using HubSpot form on a HubSpot page, I tried similar code like this but somehow it was not creating submissions for the contact
Yes, that's within a custom module on a HubSpot page.
Demo here: <https://www.stephanieogaygarcia.com/HubSpot-custom-module-demo-multi-step-form-slider> (ouch, need to update those font colours)
Hi All! I'm a Product Manager at a B2B Data company running point on our new HubSpot integration! Looking forward to learning everything I can!

Hi Everyone, As a super admin, i created a new user to my company and gave him limited access, The new user with limited access get logged in to his account successfully and requested me a bit more access. I updated the access to that user. But that user can't access those pages until he logs out and login again. Why is it so? Why not it should be like when i update access/permission, he get the access on page refresh?
thanks Stephanie :slightly_smiling_face:
Hello everyone! I'm a Swedish tech lead at the awesome communication agency called <https://maverickbysigma.se>
